alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:25AM EST until January 12 at 5:40AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Massachusetts... Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackstone River at Woonsocket. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding will be comparable to the March floods of 2010. Flooding is likely in lower lying sections of Woonsocket and Cumberland. Deep floodwaters are expected in the lower level of the River Island Condominiums in Woonsocket. Several businesses along the river will have several feet of water into their parking areas, including the parking lot for the Cumberland school district buses. Vehicles should be moved from these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 14.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
